events.name: I/O Extended 2018 GDG Craiova Dev News
events.description:
Google I/O Extended by GDG Craiova

Google I/O is an annual developer conference held by Google that brings together developers from around the globe for talks, hands-on learning with Google experts, and a first look at Google’s latest developer products. This year’s developer festival will be held May 8-10 at the Shoreline Amphitheatre in Mountain View, CA and we are extremely excited to host a GOOGLE I/O EXTENDED event here in Craiova

I/O Extended events help developers from around the world take part in the I/O experience.

We're going to discuss the latest news and releases from this year.

Agenda
TBD

This event is free.
events.how_to_find_us: Vizavi de Teatrul National, cum veniti dinspre Hotel Helin Central, cu 15 metri pana in Spartan, prin gangul de langa fostul Lux Premier, prima pe stanga, la etaj, urmariti indicatoarele cu Scoala Informala

events.name: Next '18 Extended - Craiova
events.description:
Google Cloud Next is the I/O equivalent for enterprise developers, customers, and other industry partners.

Join us for this year's Next Extended event, where we'll bring together cloud enthusiasts and the developer community to be a part of the Next '18 experience.

This year we will be diving deep into cloud with technical keynotes, a hands-on TOPIC (Kubernetes, ML, or Google Cloud Certification) codelab and specialized speakers.

As an attendee, you'll not only be a part of our vibrant cloud community but also receive free access to Qwiklabs (a $55+ value)!
Select your preference here:
https://www.meetup.com/gdg-craiova/polls/1266964/

Don't forget to bring a laptop (PC, Mac, or Chromebook) and get ready for the best Next Extended yet!

Make sure to RSVP to receive upcoming information about this event and visit https://cloudnext.withgoogle.com/ to learn more about Google Cloud Next '18.

Agenda
19:00 - 21:00 Dive into the world of Docker and Kubernetes

This event is free.

PS NU UITATI SA VENITI CU LAPTOPUL PERSONAL
events.how_to_find_us: Vizavi de Teatrul National, cum veniti dinspre Hotel Helin Central, cu 15 metri pana in Spartan, prin gangul de langa fostul Lux Premier, prima pe stanga, la etaj, urmariti indicatoarele cu Scoala Informala

events.name: Firebase - hot sauce for your app

venue.name: The Ramada Plaza Hotel, Henri Coanda meeting room

events.description:
This meetup is a joined forces meetup between GDG Craiova and Softelligence Engineering Craiova - our partener for this event.

From the GDG Craiova part, we have a very special guest who works together with the Firebase team in Canada, at Google. His name is Alex Sandu Astrum and he will introduce us into the Firebase world.

From our partner and sponsor for this event, Softelligence Engineering,
there will be a very interesting presentation related to automated testing for web application held by Mihai Vladu & Cătălin Ursu.

Please, don't RSVP with yes if you don't plan to join this meetup.
(Va rugam sa nu raspundeti cu Da daca nu planuiti sa veniti la acest eveniment). We have limited seats number.

In order to join our meetup, please complete the next form:
https://goo.gl/forms/1GeunzvzEziIMzd23

Agenda:
18:00 - 18:30 - Registration
18:30 - 19:45 - Alex Sandu Astrum(Google) - Firebase - hot sauce for your app
19:45 - 20:30 - Mihai Vladu & Cătălin Ursu(Softelligence) - Automated testing for web applications
20:30 - 20:55 Community panel: Cristian Dascălu, vlogger
20:55 - 21:10 Networking
Location:
- Hotel Ramada, Henri Coanda meeting room

Presentations:
1) Firebase - hot sauce for your app

Briefing:
We'll discover the best Firebase has to offer to web developers. We'll talk about well known & loved BaaS products, like Firestore & Cloud Functions, as well as the new cool integrations Firebase released this year.

2) Automated testing for web applications

Briefing:
A walkthrough on the process of transforming business requirements into validated behavior expectations using a continuous test management platform. The presentation will showcase the use of web tools based on test cases defined in Gherkin language for automation testing of a web application. We will be using Hiptest as the test management platform and Cucumber JS to transform data in order to be automated in Nightwatch JS framework, the test runs will be available in a cross-browser cloud environment named Saucelabs.

About Speakers:

Alex is a Software Engineer with 10+ years of web/mobile development experience, currently working at Google in Canada. He has been working also for some top software companies in Bucharest. He is enjoying Firebase, Angular & good design.
Outside work, he loves games, surfing & EDM.

Mihai is a software engineer with a Master's degree in Computer Engineering and part of Softelligence Engineering’s team. He has always worked as a fullstack developer on various web applications and loves diving into new technologies and tools whenever he has some spare time. When not coding, he enjoys playing football, skiing or fishing.

Catalin is a software QA engineer and a member of the Softelligence Engineering team. With more than 6 years’ experience in QA, Catalin's desire to innovate is steered through implementing QA best practices and being involved on various products and domains, from broadcasting management systems to e-learning applications. In his spare time he likes playing football, going to the gym, skiing and traveling.
events.how_to_find_us: Hotel Ramada is located very close to the city center at the crossroads of Calea Bucuresti with Stefan cel Mare street.

events.name: Google HashCode 2019 Contest

venue.name: Faculty of Automation, Computers and Electronics

events.description:
Joi, 28 februarie 2019, începând cu ora 19:00, se va desfășura competiția online Google Hash Code, in cadrul Facultății de Automatică, Calculatoare şi Electronică, sala S7A ( turn, etajul 7)

Pentru a putea participa este necesar să faci parte dintr-o echipă. Înregistrarea individuală a fiecăruia dintre cei 2-4 membri ai unei echipe este deschisă până la data de 25 februarie 2019 ora 12:00 CET pe site-ul: https://codingcompetitions.withgoogle.com/hashcode

Hash Code este o competiție globală de programare între toate echipele înscrise în concurs, organizată anul acesta pentru a 6-a oară de către Google, în două etape:
- etapa de calificare online se va desfășura în ziua de 28 februarie 2019, în intervalul orar 19:00 – 23:00,in cadrul Facultății de Automatică, Calculatoare şi Electronică (revenim cu detalii legate de sală)
- etapa finală se va desfășura în ziua de 27 aprilie 2019, la sediul Google din Dublin.

Cine poate participa?
Sunt așteptați să participe studenți (de orice nivel) și / sau profesioniști în domeniul IT sau un domeniu corelat (Informatică, Informatică Economică, Matematică, Automatizări și Calculatoare, etc.)

Unde mă înregistrez?
Înregistrarea oficială pe site-ul https://codingcompetitions.withgoogle.com/hashcode este obligatorie pentru cei ce doresc să participe. De asemenea, vă rugăm să trimiteți un email la [masked] în caz că doriți să participați dar nu aveţi echipă, pentru a putea asigura locuri pentru toți participanții.

Pentru mai multe detalii despre eveniment urmăriți pagina noastră de Facebook (GDG Craiova - https://www.facebook.com/gdg.craiova/), contactați organizatorii la adresa de email [masked] sau urmăriți pagina oficială https://codingcompetitions.withgoogle.com/hashcode

Google I/O is an annual developer conference held by Google that brings together developers from around the globe for talks, hands-on learning with Google experts, and a first look at Google’s latest developer products. events.name: GDG DevFest Craiova 2019
events.description:
GDG DevFest Craiova is happening on November 16th and should be the biggest IT conference ever held in Craiova.

We've got Googlers, Google Developer Experts and Industry Professionals who will present the latest technologies on 3 different tracks:
- Angular & Web Development
- AI & Machine Learning & IoT
- Cloud & Data Engineering

Tickets and more details here: https://devfest.gdgcraiova.dev/

GDG DevFests are large, community-run developer events happening around the globe focused on community building and learning about Google’s technologies.

GDG DevFest Craiova is a community event, made by the community for the community. The main purpose of this conference is to bring together tech specialists and give to the attendees the possibility to participate in their presentations and ask them questions about their common passions: technology and programming.
events.how_to_find_us: Just across Sf. Dumitru Metropolitan Cathedral.

events.name: Community Speedrun Challenge
events.description:
Hello!

We’re sure most of you have learning new technologies and tools as New Year’s resolutions. That’s why we’re excited to participate in the the first Community Speedrun Challenge that Google is organizing for developer communities in Europe. And as part of the GDG Craiova, you’re among the first to know about this!

The Community Speedrun Challenge is a training program that will run in February where you’ll have the opportunity to join four Speedruns and get hands-on experience with tools like Kubernetes, Assistant, BigQuery our Cloud Run, Every Speedrun is open for a week to give you the ability to finish all labs in your best time, scoring more points and winning prizes.

Find more information and register here: https://bit.ly/speedrunchallenge0220

The Community Speedrun Challenge has four Speedruns that take place in February.
Each Speedrun is open for a week and each Speedrun kicks off with a webinar by a Google trainer on Monday evening. Players can decide on which/how many Speedruns they want to participate.

Schedule:
- Speedrun Start Dates: February 3, 10, 17 and 24
- Webinar Time: Mondays from 8pm to 10pm (GMT+2)

Topics
BigQuery Basics for Data Analysts
Kubernetes in the Google Cloud
Google Developer Essentials
Hello Cloud Run.

Example Speedrun #1:
- Mon, 3rd of February: Webinar with Lab #1
- Speedrun open from Feb, 3rd-9th
- Attendees complete the rest of the labs in the Speedrun in their own time

This event is online only, but please also join this meetup if you plan to register for the challenge.

Prizes:
- All participants will get one-month free subscription to Qwiklabs and earn a badge for each Speedrun they complete
- Top 5 of each Speedrun will receive $25 voucher for the Google Merchandise Store
- Top Winner from each Speedrun receives an extra $50 voucher for the Google Merchandise Store

events.name: Evolving a Clean, Pragmatic Architecture with Victor Rentea, Java Champion
events.description:
Evolving a Clean, Pragmatic Architecture

--- Agenda ---
18:00 Gathering up
18:30 Talk1 (1h)
19:30 Break for food
20:00 Live-Coding (1h)

--- First Part: Talk ---
Let’s have a brainstorm! Let’s pragmatically review the key decisions of a typical enterprise application architecture and learn to balance simplicity with design goals.

We know that without continuous refactoring, simplistic design always degenerates into a Big Ball of Mud, under the assault of new features and patchy bugfixes. At the other end however, over-engineered code can burden the start-up of the development and sometimes even lock the developers in some rigid ‘a-priori’ design. It’s our duty to regularly challenge the architecture of our system and seek ways to simplify it to fit our present needs. Join this talk and learn how to do just-in-time design to keep as many use-cases as simple as possible (KISS).

“Architecture is the art of postponing decisions”, claims Uncle Bob. This session takes this idea further and explains how to Evolve a Pragmatic, Clean Architecture. It’s the philosophy Victor applied to design and develop numerous applications for IBM, and a key topic of the trainings he delivered at dozens of companies.

Along the way, you’ll also get a review of the fundamental data structure types (Entity, VO, DTO), logic class (Services, Facades, Adapters and Repositories) along with several techniques to keep the logic simple via two types of extractions, enforcing boundaries using dependency directions, and crafting a testable design. All in a fun, dynamic and interactive session you will never forget.

----- 2nd part: Live-Coding -----

For the second part of the meetup, Victor will perform a live-coding session on a topic the audience selects during break (voting). Among the topics:
- Test-Driven Development
- Functional Programming with Java 8
- Refactoring Exercise

---- Who: Victor Rentea -----

Victor Rentea is Java Champion and one of the top Independent Trainers in Romania, having trained by now 1500+ developers in 30+ companies. He is Lead Architect at IBM, where he practices Pair Programming, Clean Code and Refactoring every day. For the community, he organized the largest 3 Bucharest Java User Group meetups in history, and last year he founded the Bucharest Software Craftsmanship Community in which he runs free webinars about clean code, refactoring and TDD.

As a speaker, Victor is now regularly invited at the top international conferences: his live-coding sessions are insane, lightning-fast but well crafted, full of enthusiasm, deep insights and take-away tips. To learn more about/from him, follow his daily thoughts on LinkedIn, Facebook or Twitter, or check out http://victorrentea.ro.

The entry to this meetup is free of any charges, but there is a limited amount of available seats, so hurry up and reserve your seat by RSVP-ing to this meetup.

We also want to give our thanks to the sponsors of this meetup: eMag and Şcoala informală de IT

upcoming.name: Google HashCode Contest 2020

venue.name: Faculty of Automation, Computers and Electronics

upcoming.description:
Joi, 20 februarie 2020, începând cu ora 19:00, se va desfășura competiția online Google Hash Code, in cadrul Facultății de Automatică, Calculatoare şi Electronică

Pentru a putea participa este necesar să faci parte dintr-o echipă. Înregistrarea individuală a fiecăruia dintre cei 2-4 membri ai unei echipe este deschisă până la data de 17 februarie 2019 ora 23:59 CET pe site-ul: https://codingcompetitions.withgoogle.com/hashcode

Hash Code este o competiție globală de programare între toate echipele înscrise în concurs, organizată anul acesta pentru a 7-a oară de către Google, în două etape:
- etapa de calificare online se va desfășura în ziua de 20 februarie 2020, în intervalul orar 19:00 – 23:00,in cadrul Facultății de Automatică, Calculatoare şi Electronică (revenim cu detalii legate de sală)
- etapa finală se va desfășura în ziua de 25 aprilie 2020, la sediul Google din Dublin.

Cine poate participa?
Sunt așteptați să participe studenți (de orice nivel) și / sau profesioniști în domeniul IT sau un domeniu corelat (Informatică, Informatică Economică, Matematică, Automatizări și Calculatoare, etc.)

De ce cunostinte de programare am nevoie?
Structuri de date, algoritmi si lucrul cu fisiere (citire din/ scriere in). Nu conteaza limbajul, poate fi C++, Java, Python, C# sau chiar MatLab

Unde mă înregistrez?
Înregistrarea oficială pe site-ul https://codingcompetitions.withgoogle.com/hashcode este obligatorie pentru cei ce doresc să participe. De asemenea, vă rugăm să trimiteți un email la [masked] în caz că doriți să participați dar nu aveţi echipă, pentru a putea asigura locuri pentru toți participanții.
Asigurati-va ca ati selectat hub-ul: University of Craiova, Faculty of Automation, Computers and Electronics

Agenda concursului:

19:00 - 19:30 Primirea si inscrierea participantilor / networking
19:30 - Deadline pentru formarea echipelor si anuntarea problemei (livestream de la Google)
19:45 - Problema si testele sunt disponibile pe platforma de jurizare, inceperea propriu-zisa a competitiei
22:30 - Clasamentul live nu mai este disponibil
23:30 - Se termina competitia iar platforma de jurizare nu mai accepta trimiterea de solutii
23:40 - Se afiseaza statisticile rundei ( livestream de la Google )
23:59 - Inchiderea hub-ului

Pentru mai multe detalii despre eveniment urmăriți pagina noastră de Facebook (GDG Craiova - https://www.facebook.com/gdg.craiova/), meetup (https://meetup.com/gdg-craiova), contactați organizatorii la adresa de email [masked] sau urmăriți pagina oficială https://codingcompetitions.withgoogle.com/hashcode

Demo video:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?&v=DOlH_qrMPao
upcoming.how_to_find_us: Vom anunta in curand laboratoarele unde se va desfasura concursul.

group_profile.intro: I am a passionate Software Engineer and also a trainer at Informal School of IT(Scoala informala de IT), having more than fifteen years of experience in the IT domain.
I'm a Front-end developer at iQuest. I help building complex applications using the latest and greatest in what JavaScript has to offer.
